irrigation: Water crops early morning or evening to reduce evaporation. Use drip irrigation for efficiency.
pests: Use neem spray or biological pest control. Avoid repeated use of same pesticide.
soil: Test soil pH regularly. Add compost or organic manure to maintain fertility.
weather: Check local weather before sowing or applying fertilizer.
market: Sell directly through FPOs or government eNAM for better prices.
fertilizer: Apply fertilizers based on soil test reports. Avoid overuse to protect soil.
crop rotation: Rotate crops each season to maintain soil nutrients and control pests.
irrigation schedule: Water every 3–4 days for vegetables and every 7–10 days for grains in normal weather.
